eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.utils

Class FlexibleUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.utils.FlexibleUtils

  • public final class FlexibleUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Set of utility methods most used in all applications.
    Since:
    27/01/2016 Created in main package
    17/12/2017 Moved into UI package
    12/05/2018 Added even more utils
    See Also:
    DrawableUtils, LayoutUtils

      • highlightText

        public static void highlightText(@NonNull
                                 android.widget.TextView textView,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.lang.String originalText,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.lang.String constraint)
        Sets a spannable text with the accent color into the provided TextView.

        Multiple matches will be highlighted, but if the 2nd match is consecutive, the highlight is skipped.

        Internally calls fetchAccentColor(Context, int).
        Parameters:
        textView - the TextView to transform and which the originalText is assigned to
        originalText - the original text which the transformation is applied to
        constraint - the text to highlight
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        highlightText(TextView, String, String, int), highlightWords(TextView, String, String)

      • highlightText

        public static void highlightText(@NonNull
                                 android.widget.TextView textView,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.lang.String originalText,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.lang.String constraint,
                                 int color)
        Sets a spannable text with any highlight color into the provided TextView.

        Multiple matches will be highlighted, but if the 2nd match is consecutive, the highlight is skipped.

        Parameters:
        textView - the TextView to transform and which the originalText is assigned to
        originalText - the original text which the transformation is applied to
        constraint - the text to highlight
        color - the highlight color
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        highlightText(TextView, String, String), highlightWords(TextView, String, String, int)

      • highlightWords

        public static void highlightWords(@NonNull
                                  android.widget.TextView textView,
                                  @Nullable
                                  java.lang.String originalText,
                                  @Nullable
                                  java.lang.String constraints)
        Sets a spannable text with the accent color for each word provided by the constraint text into the provided TextView.

        Note:

        • Words are automatically split by "([, ]+)" regular expression.
        • To Actually see the text highlighted, the filter must check words too.
        • Internally calls fetchAccentColor(Context, int).

        Parameters:
        textView - the TextView to transform and which the originalText is assigned to
        originalText - the original text which the transformation is applied to
        constraints - the multiple words to highlight
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        highlightWords(TextView, String, String, int), highlightText(TextView, String, String)

      • highlightWords

        public static void highlightWords(@NonNull
                                  android.widget.TextView textView,
                                  @Nullable
                                  java.lang.String originalText,
                                  @Nullable
                                  java.lang.String constraints,
                                  int color)
        Sets a spannable text with any highlight color for each word provided by the constraint text into the provided TextView.

        Note:

        • Words are automatically split by "([, ]+)" regular expression.
        • To Actually see the text highlighted, the filter must check words too.

        Parameters:
        textView - the TextView to transform and which the originalText is assigned to
        originalText - the original text which the transformation is applied to
        constraints - the multiple words to highlight
        color - the highlight color
        Since:
        1.0.0-b1
        See Also:
        highlightWords(TextView, String, String), highlightText(TextView, String, String, int)

      • adjustAlpha

        public static int adjustAlpha(int color,
                              int alpha)
        Adjusts the alpha of a color.
        Parameters:
        color - the color
        alpha - the alpha value we want to set 0-255
        Returns:
        the adjusted color

      • resetAccentColor

        public static void resetAccentColor()
        Reset the internal accent color to INVALID_COLOR, to give the possibility to re-fetch it at runtime, since once it is fetched it cannot be changed.

      • fetchAccentColor

        public static int fetchAccentColor(android.content.Context context,
                                   int defColor)
        Optimized method to fetch the accent color on devices with at least Lollipop.

        If accent color has been already fetched it is simply returned.

        Parameters:
        context - context
        defColor - value to return if the accentColor cannot be found

      • reveal

        public static void reveal(android.view.View view,
                          int centerX,
                          int centerY)
        Create the reveal effect animation.
        Parameters:
        view - the View to reveal
        centerX - the x coordinate of the center of the animating circle, relative to view.
        centerY - the y coordinate of the center of the animating circle, relative to view.
        Since:
        1.0.0-b4

      • unReveal

        public static void unReveal(android.view.View view,
                            int centerX,
                            int centerY)
        Create the un-reveal effect animation.

        View will be set as visibility GONE.

        Parameters:
        view - the View to reveal
        centerX - the x coordinate of the center of the animating circle, relative to view.
        centerY - the y coordinate of the center of the animating circle, relative to view.
        Since:
        1.0.0-b4
